articles.title: UK CMA Backtracks Again, Speeds Toward Microsoft/Activision Blizzard Approval - Thurrott.com
articles.description: Less than one hour after Microsoft's legal victory against the FTC on Friday, the UK CMA blinked and backtracked yet again.
articles.content: Less than one hour after Microsoft’s legal victory against the U.S Federal Trade Commission (FTC) on Friday, the UK Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) backtracked again and said that it could ap… [+2056 chars]

articles.author: Enrico de Lazaro
articles.title: Webb May Have Spotted Supermassive Dark Stars - Sci.News
articles.description: New research shows that JADES-GS-z13-0, JADES-GS-z12-0, and JADES-GS-z11-0 -- three high-redshift galaxy candidates detected by Webb -- are consistent with a supermassive dark star interpretation.
articles.content: The first generation of stars in the Universe is yet to be observed. There are two leading theories for those objects: hydrogen burning Population III stars and the so-called dark stars, made of hydr… [+3650 chars]

articles.author: Robin McKie
articles.title: 'Mindblowing': how James Webb telescope's snapshots of infant universe transformed astronomy - The Guardian
articles.description: Their light took more than 13bn years to reach Nasa’s £6.8bn James Webb probe and this snapshot of the infant universe is thrilling scientists
articles.content: It took a remarkably long time for the light emitted by a group of ancient galaxies to reach the James Webb space telescope last year. Astronomers have calculated that the photons were in transit for… [+13081 chars]

articles.title: The Perseids Meteor Shower Has Begun: When To See It At Its Best - Forbes
articles.description: Tonight sees the start of the annual meteor shower that brings the most excitement and dependable displays—the Perseids. This year it peaks in moonless skies.
